variants.Description in input context: c.248G>A (p.G83D) causes a structural change in the protein, affecting its function.
Variant found to contribute to instability of the TP53 protein.
Silent mutation, but influences protein folding.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression was reduced by 50% for the variant NM_001126112.3:c.248G>A.
Protein half life significantly reduced with mutation NM_001126112.3:c.300C>T, indicating increased degradation.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent experiments were performed, each using a new passage of cells.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate on the Western blot.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by Tukey's post-hoc test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression between 80% and 120% of control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% or greater than 150% of control.
